title: 96/451/EC: Commission Decision of 26 June 1996 authorizing Finland to pay certain aids in the pig- and poultry-breeding sectors
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 26 June 1996 authorizing Finland to pay certain aids in the pig- and poultry-breeding sectors (96/451/EC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The aid measures for the pig- and poultry-breeding sectors notified by Finland on 23 February 1996 are hereby approved.
The maximum level of aid, granted in the form of interest-rate subsidies or capital subsidies, shall be as follows:
- 30 % of the total cost of the investment for aid granted under decisions taken by 31 December 1996,
- 27 % of the total cost of the investment for aid granted under decisions taken between 1 January and 31 December 1997,
- 24 % of the total cost of the investment for aid granted under decisions taken between 1 January and 31 December 1998,
- 20 % of the total cost of the investment for aid granted under decisions taken between 1 January and 31 December 1999.
The aid shall be abolished by 31 December 1999.

During the period of application of the aid provided for in Article 1, Finland shall notify the Commission:
- twice a year of the pig- and egg-production capacity,
- once a year of the poultry-production capacity,
- once a month of the number of pigs and poultry slaughtered and the number of eggs packed.
This Decision is addressed to the Republic of Finland.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 26 June 1996.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
Member of the Commission
